"Damian Murphy" <damodai@...> wrote:
>
> I think that your problem is that =
you have installed a JRE on your
> machine and this is what is referenced i=
n your windows
> registry.(HKEY_CURRENT_USERS->Software->Javasoft->Java Run=
time
> Environment) this is where the jre1.5.0_06\lib is found.
> As you po=
int out tools.jar is not part of this jre.
> You can try 
> option 1)adding=
 the tools.jar file to the jre1.5.0_06\lib folder 
> option 2)uninstalling =
the JRE and installing a JDK(JDK has the 
tool.jar)
> option 3) changing th=
e entry in the registry 
>  
Damian, thanks for you help. Just in case some=
one else runs into the 
same problem. I first tried copying the tools.jar f=
ile into the JRE 
directory, that got me past the first problem, but then t=
he compiles 
failed, because they were also looking in the JRE directory. T=
hen I 
tried modifying the registry. That still didn't work. In the end I 
=
had to uninstall the JRE.

Thanks again
Janet
